column4: I'm following a tutorial for downloading Azureus (https://help.ubuntu.com/community/AzureusHowTo) and it says I need to wget http://ftp.egr.msu.edu/debian/pool/contrib/a/azureus/azureus_2.4.0.2-1_all.deb
HTTP request sent, awaiting response... 404 Not Found
you dont need to do all that just install java jre and then go to the azureus website
azureus is a pain for me with 512 ram though. there are smaller torrent clients that work well
what are they? I have 1GB of ram, but if you know better programs please tell
well ive heard good things about ctorrent. i use rtorrent but thats a terminal app.. deluge is something ive been keeping an eye on but havent tried yet
if youre on kde id just use ktorrent but in gnome..
i c.. hmm I'll check those out, but until then I have a shell script of Azureus, how do I run it? I'm sorry if this is really noob question
